title: John Travolta and Kirstie Alley reunite for Kelly Preston's 56th birthday
text:
She previously confessed she would have pursued a romantic relationship with John Travolta in the Nineties had she not been married at the time.

But now Kirstie Alley, 68, and John, 65, are firmly friends as she was seen hnging out with the actor at his wife Kelly Preston's 56th birthday party.

Kirstie and John co-starred in the movie Look Who's Talking together in 1989. They were also in the sequel, Look Who's Talking Too, in 1990 and Look Who's Talking Now in 1993.

Reunited! John Travolta and Kirstie Alley had a mini Look Who's Talking reunion over the weekend when they came together to help celebrate his wife Kelly Preston's 56th birthday

'Celebrating Kelly's birthday with family and friends,' he captioned a group photo.

Kelly's birthday celebrations took place on a boat, with the event goers all seen sitting at the back around a table with some drinks.

Kirstie rocked a patterned blouse for the event and styled her blonde hair out.

Party time: Kelly's birthday celebrations took place on a boat, with the event goers all seen sitting at the back around a table with some drinks

Trio: Kirstie rocked a patterned blouse for the event and styled her blonde hair out while sitting between Kelly and John

John was dressed in a simple black T-shirt and appeared to be enjoying a glass of white wine.

Birthday girl Kelly also appeared in high spirits as she sat next to Kirstie and her daughter, Ella, 19.

Not seen with the couple's young son, Benjamin, nine.

Long-time pals: Kirstie and John have been friends for over three decades (pictured in 1992)

John and Kirstie met on the set of the 1989 comedy, Look Who's Talking, about a single mom who finds love with a cab driver.

The Cheers star confessed to Howard Stern in 2013 that she later grew romantic feelings for John, and said they were reciprocated.

'It took me years to not look at John as a romantic interest,' she said.

And when asked if she would have pursued a relationship if she wasn't married at the time, she replied: 'We both would have.'

Movie stars: John and Kirstie met on the set of the 1989 comedy, Look Who's Talking, about a single mom who finds love with a cab driver and recently reunited for the premiere of his move, The Fanatic in August 2019

Kirstie also revealed while on Big Brother UK in 2017 that she would have gone off and married the fellow Scientologist if she wasn't married at the time.

'I think I kissed Travolta,' she told her housemates.

'I almost ran off and married John. I did love him, I still love him. If I hadn't been married I would've gone and married him and I would've been in an airplane because he has his own plane.'

Strong love: Kirstie also revealed while on Big Brother UK in 2017 that she would have gone off and married the fellow Scientologist if she wasn't married at the time (on the set of Look Who's Talking in 1989)

Kirstie was married to Parker Stevenson, 67, at the time. The pair split in 1997 after 14 years together.

The former couple are parents to William True, 27, and Lillie Price, 25.

John went on to marry Kelly in 1991 and had three children together; Jett, Ella Bleu, 19, and Benjamin, nine.

Jett, who was autistic, tragically passed away in 2009 at the age of 16 after having a seizure and hitting his head on a bathtub.
description: John Travolta and Kirstie Alley had a mini Look Who's Talking reunion over the weekend when they came together to help celebrate his wife Kelly Preston's 56th birthday.
